snippet: Two Canadians and one American caught up in the crackdown in Egypt said they were beaten, made to sleep on bug-infested floors and denied medical care.
abstract: Letters smuggled out of Egypt from Canadians Tarek Loubani and John Greyson and United States citizen Mohamed Soltan, who were caught up in continuing crackdown on the Muslim Brotherhood, offer a rare outsiders' perspective on longstanding Egyptian prison conditions; letters describe being subjected to brutal treatment.
lead_paragraph: Two Canadians and one American caught up in the crackdown in Egypt said they were beaten, made to sleep on bug-infested floors and denied medical care.

headline.main: Westerners’ Smuggled Letters Offer Glimpse of Egyptian Prisons
headline.print_headline: Westerners’ Smuggled Letters Offer Glimpse of Egyptian Prisons

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
